result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Arriola Nieto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Restitution already paid.
To be paid within 90 days or penalty of 9 days Huber for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: Plea and Sentencing, September 28, 2015, filed by Erin P. Furgason, Official Court Reporter
filed by Steve Laxton
Character
from the defendant to the witness filed in Court.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Antonio  Arriola Nieto in court with attorney Steven W. Laxton.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Laxton makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1

Restitution: Already paid
FINE: $918.00 
DNA Surcharge:  $250.00 
TO be paid in 90 days, failure to pay will result in 9 days with huber
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Antonio Arriola Nieto in court with attorney Steven W. Laxton.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective Kristen W. from the Town of Oconomowoc was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. Defense moves to dismiss and presents arguments. State objects and moves for bind over.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   Bail remains as fixed.  Arraignment scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
